command:
python3 - <<'PY'
import os, sys, subprocess, filecmp, json
if os.geteuid() != 0:
    sys.exit("root required")

cur_img = "/boot/flash/system.img"
gold_img = "/opt/golden/system.img"
mnt_cur = "/mnt/imgc"
mnt_gold = "/mnt/imgg"

os.makedirs(mnt_cur, exist_ok=True)
os.makedirs(mnt_gold, exist_ok=True)
subprocess.check_call(["mount", "-o", "ro,loop", cur_img, mnt_cur])
subprocess.check_call(["mount", "-o", "ro,loop", gold_img, mnt_gold])

dirs = ["/etc", "/bin", "/sbin"]
result = {}
for d in dirs:
    left = os.path.join(mnt_cur, d.strip("/"))
    right = os.path.join(mnt_gold, d.strip("/"))
    if os.path.isdir(left) and os.path.isdir(right):
        common = set(os.listdir(left)).intersection(os.listdir(right))
        cmpres = filecmp.cmpfiles(left, right, list(common), shallow=False)
        result[d] = {"same": cmpres[0], "diff": cmpres[1], "errors": cmpres[2]}

print(json.dumps(result))
subprocess.call(["umount", mnt_gold])
subprocess.call(["umount", mnt_cur])
PY
explanation: Performs targeted integrity checks on critical directories within mounted images using filecmp.cmpfiles to enumerate exact file-level differences.
rationale_steps: Require root to mount images read-only.
Identify common files across key system directories in both images.
Use filecmp.cmpfiles to list same, differing, and error files for focused verification.
